column4: KeyUp: Yes. Apply it recursively to your entire web directory or just the folder you want people to upload into
What's the d on file permissions for?
1st character
set a dir with files in it to 444 and try a "cat dir/file"
its not permissions, its a dir
its usually a symlink to the latest kernel in /boot
that sudo would ba valid for "wget" but not the " bash"
that sudo would be valid for "wget" only but not the " bash"
http://www.howtoforge.com/chrooted_ssh_howto_debian
Thank you very much. I'll have a look over that.
_that's_ what the shebang is for (the first line of a script, starting with #!) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shebang_(Unix)
Mhm, as I recently discovered
use an udev-rule
take this as an example http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=989780
Ah I see.
Isn't it 446?
then 4byte disk-signature, 2 NULL bytes and then partitiontable follows
Ah I see, what's the disc signature for though?
seriously: idk
Just did a bit of looking apparently the disk signature to find the boot volume
so it's ams/win thing? unix/linux doesn't need this, afaik
According to Wikipedia, it was a Windows NT feature but Linux uses it from 2.6 onwards
ah ok, thx
